result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Richard Annis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.
Must provide DNA sample and pay a $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.

Must report within 60 days from 1/8/16 - No later than 3/8/16, by 6:00 pm.
Subject to Work Release & Good Time.
May serve time at St. Croix County if approved by St. Croix County.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
